text:
How to Know If You're Addicted to Porn. Adult
materials may have their place at times, but

porn can also interfere with your life. Check
to see if you might be in trouble. You will

need Honesty and professional help. Step 1.
Determine whether you're viewing porn as a

way to waste time. This can be an early warning
sign of an addiction. Step 2. Check your browser's

history. If a majority of your favorite web
sites would make Grandma blush or if you feel

compelled to view these sites at inappropriate
times, like when you’re at work, you may

have a problem. Compulsive masturbation is
not always a sign of porn addiction. Step

3. Tally your pornography collection, including
all magazines, videos, and other "resources."

Could you open your own store? Step 4. Scrutinize
your bank statement for porn purchases. Is

it more than a car payment? Step 5. Determine
whether you prefer watching porn to engaging

in sex or other intimate relationships with
a loved one. Step 6. Notice whether you are

unable to stop viewing porn. This is a clear
sign of addiction, as is anger over a request

to stop. Step 7. If it seems that your porn
interest crosses the line into addiction territory,

seek professional help. You're not alone.
Did you know An estimated 420 million pornography-related
web pages exist on the internet today.
